data.enText: the act of supplying sb with sth that they need or want; sth that is supplied

data.chText: 政府负责提供医疗服务。
data.enText: The government is responsible for the provision of health care.
There is no provision for anyone to sit down here.

data.chText: 当局正在增加设置专门师资。
data.enText: The provision of specialist teachers is being increased.
preparations that you make for sth that might or will happen in the future

data.chText: 意外事故发生之前，他已为妻子、儿女做好了经济安排。
data.enText: He had already made provisions for (= planned for the financial future of) his wife and children before the accident.

data.chText: 你要采取措施，以防不测。
data.enText: You should make provision for things going wrong.

data.chText: 饮食供应；（尤指旅途中的）粮食
data.enText: supplies of food and drink, especially for a long journey
a condition or an arrangement in a legal document

data.chText: 按契约规定，房客负责房屋维修。
data.enText: Under the provisions of the lease, the tenant is responsible for repairs.

data.chText: 为…提供所需物品（尤指食物）
data.enText: to supply sb/sth with enough of sth, especially food, to last for a particular period of time

means: 为…提供所需物品(尤指食物)

tr: the activity of supplying or providing something
the cognitive process of thinking about what you will do in the event of something happening
example: his planning for retirement was hindered by several uncertainties
he accepted subject to one provision

tr: a store or supply of something (especially of food or clothing or arms)

value.def: The provision of something is the act of giving it or making it available to people who need or want it.

example.ex: The department is responsible for the provision of residential care services.
example.tran: 该部门负责提供家庭护理服务。

example.ex: ...nursery provision for children with special needs.
example.tran: 为有特殊需要的儿童提供护理

gramarinfo.label: also <l>a</l> N, with supp, oft N <l>of</l> n

value.def: If you make provision for something that might happen or that might need to be done, you make arrangements to deal with it.

example.ex: Mr King asked if it had ever occurred to her to make provision for her own pension...
example.tran: 金先生问她是否曾想过要为自己的养老金预先作安排。

example.ex: There is no provision for funding performance-related pay rises.
example.tran: 没有为与业绩挂钩的加薪预作资金准备。

value.tran: 预备；准备；预先采取的措施

value.def: If you make provision for someone, you support them financially and make sure that they have the things that they need.

example.ex: Special provision should be made for children...
example.tran: 应给孩子在经济上专门作好安排。

example.ex: There are very generous provisions for the mother.
example.tran: 这位母亲在物质上得到了很好的赡养。

gramarinfo.label: also N in pl, N <l>for</l> n

value.def: A provision in a law or an agreement is an arrangement which is included in it.

example.ex: He backed a provision that would allow judges to delay granting a divorce decree in some cases...
example.tran: 他赞成一项允许法官在一些情况下延迟作出离婚判决的法律条款。

example.ex: The bill's provision for the sale and purchase of land faces stiff opposition from conservatives.
example.tran: 该法案关于土地买卖的规定遭到保守派的强硬反对。

value.tran: （法律或协议的）条文，条款，规定

example.ex: On board were enough provisions for two weeks.
example.tran: 船上有足够两周吃的食物。
